snippet: Mr H drafted a social media post set for timed release linking to South Manchester Synagogue with the caption tick tock.
A scheduled post recovered from Mr H’s device contained a Google Maps link to South Manchester Synagogue with the phrase tick tock.
Officers found a Buffer-scheduled tweet containing a link to South Manchester Synagogue followed by a countdown-themed message.
One of the recovered posts linked to South Manchester Synagogue and was queued to publish five minutes after a prior message titled Statement Before the Storm.
The second post in Mr H’s Buffer queue included a map link to South Manchester Synagogue and appeared timed to follow a threatening message.
A scheduled social post discovered on the defendant’s phone featured South Manchester Synagogue as the linked location with an implied warning.
Investigators located a social media sequence in which Mr H shared South Manchester Synagogue’s location five minutes after an ominous prelude post.
Mr H used a scheduling app to time a tweet linking to South Manchester Synagogue, accompanied by a caption suggesting urgency or countdown.
A social media draft recovered from Mr H’s device linked to South Manchester Synagogue and was set to publish shortly after a threatening statement.
Digital evidence revealed a delayed post targeting South Manchester Synagogue, released shortly after a message titled Statement Before the Storm.
